speaker: Tomb of Names
lines: Shelves of slate hold thin stones engraved with one word each: a name.
Some are chipped. Some are warm. Some are missing as if borrowed for a night.
A brush and a pot of milk paint sit on a stool. The brush is newly washed.
When you inhale, dust tastes like someone else's breath.
A space yawns on the third shelf, polite and expectant.
On the wall, a message scratched by ring: 'Add nothing you won't carry.'
A second message in nail: 'Carry nothing you won't add.'
The room waits to see which you are.

choices.text: Paint your name and place it on the shelf.
Paint a lost name you dreamt long ago.
Leave the brush clean and go.
